str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To cleanse, purify, either ceremonially, actually, or morally. From hagnos; to make clean, i.e. sanctify.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go in, enter (originally: I shall go in). From eis and eimi; to enter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of hieros; a sacred place, i.e. The entire precincts of the Temple.

str2: From dia and the base of aggelos; to herald thoroughly.

(ceremonial) purification. From hagnizo; a cleansing, i.e. lustration.
A completion, fulfillment, accomplishment. From ekpleroo; completion.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An offering, sacrifice. From prosphero; presentation; concretely, an oblation or sacrifice.

str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
